subject: Design
title: The Dyson Cyclone: Reinventing the Boring
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Dyson Cyclone: Reinventing the Boring.

hook.text: James Dyson built 5,127 prototypes before his bagless vacuum worked. Every one before it failed.

buildup.text: Traditional vacuums lost suction as bags filled. Dyson saw industrial cyclone separators and had an idea.

discovery.text: Cyclonic separation uses centrifugal force to spin dust out of air â€” no bag needed, no suction loss.

twist.text: Every major manufacturer rejected Dyson's design. He had to manufacture it himself in his own factory.

climax.text: Dyson became a billionaire by redesigning the most boring appliance in the house.

punchline.text: 5,127 failures were the design process. The 5,128th was the product.

quiz.question: How many prototypes did James Dyson build before success?
